TopicTitle: Paper Space Program 1.8 (KSP Rocket Parts papercraft)

Articles.Content:
Could you upload a .zip file? Mediafire doesn't take kindly to downloading the whole folder.

Only when i'll finish the whole work If you've got any better file-sharing sites , then please pm them to me

Now that we're at it, why not put magnets on what would be the stack nodes of all parts?

PAPERCRAFT LEGO!

That is a great idea O_o

awesome!

would be cool to have a all in one zip file though

Anyway... lets see if im able to build somthing out of those parts, thanks so much for your work!

awesome!

would be cool to have a all in one zip file though

Anyway... lets see if im able to build somthing out of those parts, thanks so much for your work!

In the end it will be a zip-file

Sorry , but i'm soo bad at 3d modelling , lols

Anyone who's good at 3D modelling willing to take the challenge?

The last one can't be a glorious docking! The station doesn't have a docking port. You'll end up like me, on my first go at docking. "There's a whole lot of clanging, but no sticking"-Me, whist failing to dock.

The last one can't be a glorious docking! The station doesn't have a docking port. You'll end up like me, on my first go at docking. "There's a whole lot of clanging, but no sticking"-Me, whist failing to dock.

The station does have an extended ClampoTron Inline docking port.

Edited July 3, 2014 by GregroxMun

Some lovely stuff there indeed!!

ALT F12 > Allow Part Clipping in Editors

Great job ! It would be nice to get more pics.

And by the way, would you mind making an archive for all of your files ? MF needs to be upgraded to a pro account for just download more than 1 single file at a time (a shame !).

Great job ! It would be nice to get more pics.

And by the way, would you mind making an archive for all of your files ? MF needs to be upgraded to a pro account for just download more than 1 single file at a time (a shame !).

Edited July 6, 2014 by arc5555

No worries, I'm starting my vacation today anyway. Soooooo looking forwards to making these when I get back.

Again, fantastic job!!!
Great work. Too bad my first one I printed on Lazorprinter so BW, and looks like it hit the Mun. Got the colour printer online , so attempt number2 maybe are pic worthy. Thanks for this truly.
This is how mine turned out after about 2 hours worth of work. I can't imagine how much time an effort had to go into making them accurate to the game. I'm pretty happy with my little model though.

This is amazing! Can you please upload (or mirror) the files somewhere else? mediafire doesn't allow downloading of archives and is extremely slow to browse.

BTW, what kind of paper do you use for this? I am planning on creating a small ship and I bought 240gsm paper as it seems pretty tough.

This is how mine turned out after about 2 hours worth of work. I can't imagine how much time an effort had to go into making them accurate to the game. I'm pretty happy with my little model though.

Good one ! Didn't believe that the landing legs are possible to craft

Good one ! Didn't believe that the landing legs are possible to craft

When it comes to the landing legs you have to get a little creative. There's only 4 actual parts from the pattern that would work as intended. Some stuff had to be cut from the design and the copious amounts of glue to hold everything in place. I just really wanted to have a model of my standard lander.
